title.narrative: AWARENESS OF AND ENHANCED SKILLS TO PREVENT VAC

description.narrative: Output 3. Policy makers, professionals, community members, caregivers and children have greater awareness of and enhanced skills to prevent violence against children as a human rights and public health problem, which contributes to Promotion Of Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being And Justice, Protection From Violence, Exploitation, Abuse And Neglect. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, children, especially the most vulnerable, benefit from enhanced access to social welfare, care and justice systems to ensure their right to protection from violence, abuse and exploitation

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3. Policy makers, professionals, community members, caregivers and children have greater awareness of and enhancedskills to prevent violence against children as a human rights and public health problem

description.narrative: Professionals, caregivers and children in BiH have improved awareness;and improved skills to prevent violence against children. 693 professionals including education and police increased their capacity to prevent and respond to online violence. Children have greater awareness of and capacity to prevent violence against children including 18,840 children reached in school and 14,000 participants in extracurricular activities. | Status:Constrained | As-of Date:12/01/2022
